com.illposed.osc.utility

Class OSCByteArrayToJavaConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.illposed.osc.utility.OSCByteArrayToJavaConverter

  • public class OSCByteArrayToJavaConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to convert a byte array, conforming to the OSC byte stream format, into Java objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OSCByteArrayToJavaConverter()
      Creates a helper object for converting from a byte array to an OSCPacket object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      OSCPacket convert(byte[] bytes, int bytesLength)
      Converts a byte array into an OSCPacket (either an OSCMessage or OSCBundle).
      java.nio.charset.Charset getCharset()
      Returns the character set used to decode message addresses and string parameters.
      void setCharset(java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
      Sets the character set used to decode message addresses and string parameters.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • OSCByteArrayToJavaConverter

        public OSCByteArrayToJavaConverter()

    • Method Detail

      • getCharset

        public java.nio.charset.Charset getCharset()
        Returns the character set used to decode message addresses and string parameters.
        Returns:
        the character-encoding-set used by this converter

      • setCharset

        public void setCharset(java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Sets the character set used to decode message addresses and string parameters.
        Parameters:
        charset - the desired character-encoding-set to be used by this converter

      • convert

        public OSCPacket convert(byte[] bytes,
                         int bytesLength)
        Converts a byte array into an OSCPacket (either an OSCMessage or OSCBundle).
        Parameters:
        bytes - the storage containing the raw OSC packet
        bytesLength - indicates how many bytes the package consists of (<= bytes.length)
        Returns:
        the successfully parsed OSC packet; in case of a problem, a RuntimeException is thrown
